thread.title: Mets' Daniel Murphy ties record by homering in 5th straight playoff game
thread.title_full: Mets' Daniel Murphy ties record by homering in 5th straight playoff game - CBSSports.com

author: Dayn Perry
title: Mets' Daniel Murphy ties record by homering in 5th straight playoff game
text:
CHICAGO -- In Game 3 of the NLCS between the Mets and Cubs ( NYM-CHC GameTracker ), New York cloutsman Daniel Murphy did it again -- in which "it" is a postseason home run. Murphy in the third inning of Game 3 homered to center field off Cubs starter Kyle Hendricks , which means he's now homered in five straight postseason games. Let's roll tape ... 
Your browser does not support iframes. 
That five-game playoff homer streak ties him with (former Met) Carlos Beltran of the 2004 Astros for the all-time postseason mark. Murphy, who entered NLCS Game 3 batting .357/.379/.929 this postseason, now has six homers in the 2015 playoffs -- three of which came in the NLDS win over the Dodgers. Beltran in 2004 had a total of eight homers in 12 postseason games. 
Murphy, 30, is eligible for free agency this upcoming offseason.

Yep: Daniel Murphy did it again. (USATSI) 

Topics: Carlos Beltran , Daniel Murphy , Kyle Hendricks , Chicago Cubs , New York Mets , MLB
